content:
# The assembling machine has been successfully placed on the map at the specified position. 
# However, it is currently showing a status of `NO_POWER`, indicating that it is not connected to a power network.

# Additionally, the inventory remains unchanged after placing the assembling machine:
# - 8 wood
# - 5 stone
# - 5 iron ore
# - 5 copper ore
# - 3 iron plates
# - 5 iron gear wheels
# - 7 electronic circuits

# To resolve the power issue, I need to connect the assembling machine to a power source. 
# I can do this by placing power poles and connecting them to the assembling machine.

# Let's find a suitable position to place a power pole near the assembling machine.
power_pole_position = nearest_buildable(Prototype.SmallElectricPole)

# Place the power pole.
place_entity(Prototype.SmallElectricPole, position=power_pole_position)

# Now, I will connect the power pole to the assembling machine to ensure it receives power.
connect_entities(power_pole_position, position_to_place, Prototype.SmallElectricPole)

# After connecting, I will check the status of the assembling machine again.
print(f"Entities on the map after connecting power: {get_entities()}")

# Finally, I will check if the assembling machine is now powered and ready to work.
assembling_machine_status = inspect_inventory(position_to_place)
print(f"Assembling machine status: {assembling_machine_status}")
